statement: Given an integer n. Construct a permutation p_1, p_2, ..., p_n of length n that satisfies the following property:For 1 ≤ i ≤ n, define c_i = \lceil \frac{p_1+p_2+... +p_i}{i} \rceil, then among c_1,c_2,...,c_n there must be at least \lfloor \frac{n}{3} \rfloor - 1 prime numbers.
input_specification: InputThe first line contains an integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 10) — the number of test cases. The description of the test cases follows.In a single line of each test case, there is a single integer n (2 ≤ n ≤ 10^5) — the size of the permutation.
output_specification: OutputFor each test case, output the permutation p_1,p_2,...,p_n of length n that satisfies the condition. It is guaranteed that such a permutation always exists.
note:
In the first test case,
c1=⌈
2
1
⌉=2
,
c2=⌈
2+1
2
⌉=2
. Both are prime numbers.

c1=⌈

1

,

2
⌉=2
,

6
3
⌉=2
,
c4=⌈
10
4
⌉=3
,
c5=⌈
15
5
⌉=3
. All these numbers are prime.
